title.narrative: F.a: Support to the Tree Monocultures Related Campaign in Latin America

description.narrative: The Latin American Network against Tree Monocultures (RECOMA) will be strengthened through the project, and some monoculture cases, which represent so called solutions to the social and environmental crises, will be selected within the network (e.g. biomas s, agrofuels and REDD+). In coordination with local organizations, case studies will be implemented and stories produced regarding the impacts of monocultures to the local communities. These stories will be published through WRM’s bulletin, and local org anisations will be provided with materials on similar situations in other countries. In regard to the Uruguayan network Grupo Guayubira, new case stories will be documented and information on the impacts of tree monocultures, their alternatives, possible c onstruction of a third pulp factory and a REDD+ project drafted by the government will be communicated. Networking will take place with other Latin American civil society networks, as well as with those working in the pulp industry’s home countries. The long term aim of the project is to halt the expansion of tree monocultures by strengthening the resistance against them in Latin America through RECOMA and in Uruguay through Guayubira. The aim is on one hand for the actors resisting tree monocultures to p ossess more information on new developments promoting the expansion of monocultures, and on the other hand for the local struggles against plantations to gain more visibility. Halting of the tree monoculture expansion would result in avoiding their negativ e impacts on water bodies, soil as well as flora and fauna. Hence, local communities would be able to continue their current livelihoods and ways of life. The project beneficiaries and collaborators include local communities tackling with the impacts of tr ee monocultures, RECOMA’s member organisations in ten countries and WRM’s other collaborators.
